text: Group A of the 2019 FIFA Women's World Cup matches took place from 7 to 17 June 2019. The group consisted of the hosts nation France, Nigeria, Norway and South Korea. France and Norway, along with the third-placed team, Nigeria (as one of the four best third-placed teams), advanced to the round of 16. == Teams == Draw position Team Pot Confederation Method of qualification Date of qualification Finals appearance Last appearance Previous best performance FIFA Rankings December 2018 March 2019 A1 1 UEFA Hosts 19 March 2015 4th 2015 Fourth place (2011) 3 4 A2 3 AFC AFC Women's Asian Cup 5th place 16 April 2018 3rd 2015 Round of 16 (2015) 14 14 A3 2 UEFA UEFA Group 3 winners 4 September 2018 8th 2015 Winners (1995) 13 12 A4 4 CAF Africa Women Cup of Nations champions 27 November 2018 8th 2015 Quarter-finals (1999) 39 38 Notes == Standings == Pos Team Pld W D L GF GA GD Pts Qualification 1 France (H) 3 3 0 0 7 1 +6 9 Advance to knockout stage 2 Norway 3 2 0 1 6 3 +3 6 3 Nigeria 3 1 0 2 2 4 −2 3 4 South Korea 3 0 0 3 1 8 −7 0 Source: FIFA Rules for classification: Tiebreakers (H) Host. In the round of 16: * The winners of Group A, France, advanced to play the third-placed team of Group C, Brazil. * The runners-up of Group A, Norway, advanced to play the runners-up of Group C, Australia. * The third-placed team of Group A, Nigeria, advanced to play the winners of Group B, Germany (as one of the four best third-placed teams). ==Matches== All times listed are local, CEST
